alert.note: Alert for Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 10:55AM MST until February 24 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Increases with coverage and intensity of snow are expected late this afternoon and into tonight. * WHERE...Teller County and the Rampart Range, including Pikes Peak. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
